alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess; Stephenson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 7:54AM CDT until August 07 at 11:15AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR EASTERN JO DAVIESS AND STEPHENSON COUNTIES... At 754 AM CDT, Law enforcement and emergency management indicated flash flooding was ongoing across the warned area. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen from Lena to Red Oak. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Emergency management reported water flowing over numerous roads, and water in the road maintenance building in Freeport. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Freeport, Lena, Stockton, Warren, Pearl City, Cedarville, Davis, Dakota, German Valley, Apple River, Winslow, Rock City, Ridott, Nora, Buena Vista, Loran, Rock Grove, Oneco, Orangeville and Kent. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
